result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Anthony Aymong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:21 AM Defendant Justin Anthony Aymong appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Justin Anthony Aymong.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Defendant waives right to pre sentence investigation. Court orders sentence withheld, 3 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, AODA, DVIP, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, take any medications as prescribed, costs due to Clerk of Court, 118 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:09 P M Defendant Justin Anthony Aymong in court in custody at Rock County Jail, by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily, rights given.  Court binds Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to defendant, reading waived.  Defendant plea not guilty.  Jury trial to be set.  Attny Isaacson request bond modification hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity: initial Appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:36 PM Defendant Justin Anthony Aymong in court in custody by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Kyle J. Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $500.00 cash bond set with conditions.  Level 4, justice point.  Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 2:00pm.

No contact directly or indirectly or via text with victim J.K.C., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Defendant to wear GPS monitoring bracelet with the instruction Defendant not to be within 500 feet of 2440 Sunshine Lane in Beloit.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
